name: Countisbury to Arnold's Linhay circular walk

ai.summary: A short, easy circular hike of about 3.1 km starting at Countisbury and looping back via Arnold's Linhay. The route is suitable for families and casual walkers, with gentle gradients, hedged lanes, and rural scenery. Expect quiet lanes, farm country ambience, and some picturesque views along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily well-maintained footpaths and rural tracks. Occasional uneven or grassy sections and gates or stiles. Some sections may be muddy after rain; footwear with good grip is helpful. Mostly level with gentle inclines.
ai.safety_notes: Carry water and weather-appropriate clothing. Wear sturdy footwear and stay on public rights of way. Watch for livestock and gates; gates may be tight for children or pets. Paths can be muddy and slippery in wet weather; check forecast and daylight hours; stay aware of uneven ground and narrow lanes when crossing fields.
recommended_gear: Map, compass or offline map app
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn offer mild weather and pleasant scenery; the route is suitable year-round, but summer can be busier and winter may bring wind and rain.
